com.mapquest.android.maps
Class LineOverlay

java.lang.Object
  com.mapquest.android.maps.Overlay
      com.mapquest.android.maps.LineOverlay

public class LineOverlay
extends Overlay

LineOverlay is an extension of a map Overlay intended for drawing a line on a MapView

The line overlay can be used to draw a route ribbon, as used in the RouteManager class

LineOverlay

public LineOverlay()
Initializes a new LineOverlay Requires the caller to set the line data using one of the methods:
  • setData(List)
  • setData(List, boolean)
  • setData(List, BoundingBox)

LineOverlay

public LineOverlay(android.graphics.Paint linePaint)
Initializes a new LineOverlay with a Paint object used for the line's color, alpha, and stroke width (as defined by Paint.getColor(), Paint.getAlpha(), and Paint.getStrokeWidth()) Requires the caller to set the line data using one of the methods:
  • setData(List)
  • setData(List, boolean)
  • setData(List, BoundingBox)

Parameters:
linePaint - object reference for LineOverlay's color, alpha, and stroke width
Method Detail

setData

public void setData(java.util.List<GeoPoint> data,
                    BoundingBox bbox)
Sets the data to be used to draw as a line as provided by a List of GeoPoint objects and BoundingBox that acts as a clipping region for the overlay

Parameters:
data - list of GeoPoint objects used as drawing coordinates to draw the line
bbox - used to clip the drawing of the line

setData

public void setData(java.util.List<GeoPoint> data,
                    boolean recomputeBoundingBox)
Sets the data to be used to draw as a line as provided by a List of GeoPoint objects

Parameters:
data - list of GeoPoint objects used as drawing coordinates to draw the line
recomputeBoundingBox - true is the overlay should automatically recalculate the entire bounding box necessary to draw the overlay,
false if the overlay's current BoundingBox should be retained

Parameters:
data - list of GeoPoint objects used as drawing coordinates to draw the line

setShowPoints

public void setShowPoints(boolean showPoints,
                          android.graphics.Paint pointPaint)
Sets whether the line overlay should show extra definition around the line's data points

Parameters:
showPoints - true if the line's points should be shown, false if the line should be a consistent color
paint - object reference for LineOverlay's stroke width

isSimplify

public boolean isSimplify()
States if line simplification is enabled for this overlay

Returns:
simplify

setSimplify

public void setSimplify(boolean simplify,
                        int tolerance)
Sets whether overlay should simplify the data points. The simplification offers drawing performance for very a large data points in a line. However due to simplification, there are possibilities of line not overlaying correctly over the map. The simplification can be tweaked by specifying tolerance limit in pixels. To use SDK's default value specify a negative value.

Parameters:
simplify - a boolean flag to turn on and off the line simplification
tolerance - the minimum distance in pixels that should be used for considering a data point in the simplified curve from the original curve.

draw

public void draw(android.graphics.Canvas canvas,
                 MapView mapView,
                 boolean shadow)
Contains operations to draw the line.

This method performs some checks to only draw the points that are within the map bounds, however, it does not do any optimization of the points. It is up to the creator to provide an efficient set of data (e.g not to include large amounts of points outside the mapView - you can always modify the line's data using setData(List) to optimize performance)

Overrides:
draw in class Overlay
Parameters:
canvas - drawing canvas of the mapView
mapView - mapView where this request was started
shadow - draw the shadow or not on the current pass

onTap

public boolean onTap(GeoPoint gp,
                     MapView mapView)
If the overlay has an OverlayTapListener and the tapped point is near the line, pass the event to the Overlay.tapListener

Overrides:
onTap in class Overlay
Parameters:
gp - the tapped point
mapView - the host MapView object
Returns:
true if the tapped point was near the line and there was a tapListener on the overlay, false if not

addPoint

protected void addPoint(GeoPoint geoPoint,
                        int maxPoints)
Adds a GeoPoint to the existing List of GeoPoint objects that make up the line overlay

Parameters:
geoPoint - point to be added to the overlay's data
maxPoints - set the maximum number of points to be included in this overlay's data. Use 0 if no max value
